snippet: For-profit companies are placing clothing-donation bins across New York City with impunity, blocking sidewalks, attracting graffiti and undermining the efforts of traditional charities.
abstract: Side Street column; growing number of companies, many based in New Jersey, are illegally placing used-clothing bins throughout New York City; receptacles typically have signs that indicate donated goods will go to the poor or to legitimate charities but officials say much of what is collected is often sold in thrift stores or in bulk overseas for profit.
lead_paragraph: For-profit companies are placing clothing-donation bins across New York City with impunity, blocking sidewalks, attracting graffiti and undermining the efforts of traditional charities.

headline.main: With a ‘Charitable Veneer,’ Littering the Streets With Collection Bins
headline.print_headline: With a ‘Charitable Veneer,’ Littering the Streets With Collection Bins
